steps.description: Enter a name for the group you want to set up. For example, Project Planning Meeting.
steps.label: Group Name
steps.title: Group Name

steps.description: Select the Google Calender, which will be used to create events for this type of meetings.
steps.label: Event Creator
steps.title: Event Creator

steps.description: [Optional] You can select a user who'll be added as an event organizer for this group. This will only be used in the ics file which is generated for the event.
steps.label: Event Organizer
steps.title: Event Organizer

steps.description: Using this table, you can select the members who'll be joining this meeting.
steps.label: Members
steps.title: Members

steps.description: Select a user who'll be a member in this meeting.
steps.label: User
steps.title: Members - User

steps.description:
Check this if this user is a mandatory member for this meeting.
The slots will be calculated based on the availabilities of only the mandatory members. There must be atleast one mandatory member in an appointment group.
steps.label: Is Mandatory
steps.title: Members - Is Mandatory

steps.description: You can add more members in this table.
steps.label: Members
steps.title: Members

steps.description: Enter the duration, for how long this event will go on.
steps.label: Duration For Event
steps.title: Duration for Event

steps.description: [Optional] You can set a buffer time between meetings using this field. For example, if you set it to 30 minutes, any meeting scheduled for this type will have atleast 30 minutes gap in between.
steps.label: Minimum Buffer Time
steps.title: Minimum Buffer Time

steps.description: [Optional] You can set number of days here such that the slots will be visible after these number of days from the current date.
steps.label: Minimum Notice Before Event
steps.title: Minimum Notice Before Event

steps.description: [Optional] You can enter number of days here such that the slots will be visible only for these many days after the current date.
steps.label: Event Availability Window
steps.title: Event Availability Window

steps.description:
[Optional] By setting this, you can limit the number of events of this type that can be booked in a single day. For example, setting it to 2 will ensure only 2 events of this type will appear on your calendar for a day.
If this limit gets exhausted, no more slots will be visible for that day in your calendar.
steps.label: Limit booking frequency
steps.title: Limit Booking Frequency

steps.description: Enable this to only allow one event for this appointment group.
steps.label: Schedule only once
steps.title: Schedule Only Once

steps.description:
Select the Meeting Provider that you would like to use to schedule meetings.
You can choose from the following:
  • None: Use this to not schedule a meeting.
  • Custom: Use this to enter a custom meeting link, for example your personal zoom meeting url. If you choose this, enter your custom link in the field Meet Link.
  • Zoom: Use this to schedule a new meeting using Zoom. Only works if zoom is enabled in Scheduler Settings
  • Google Meet: Use this to schedule a new meeting using Google Meet.
steps.label: Meet Provider
steps.title: Meeting Provider

steps.description: After someone schedules a meeting with you, a mail will be sent to them using this email template. You can either create a new email template, or select the default one [Default] Appointment Scheduled. You can also create a copy of this default template, and add your custom branding on this.
steps.label: Response Email Template
steps.title: Response Email Template

steps.description: Enable this to send availability alerts over email. Availability alerts allows checking for number of slots available for this appointment group, and if it is below a certain threashold, it triggers an email. This is useful to ensure there are always slots available for an appointment group.
steps.label: Send email alerts
steps.title: Availability Alerts

steps.description: Email alerts will only be sent if available slots falls below this threshold. Defaults to 2. Set to -1 to always send alerts.
steps.label: Minimum Threshold
steps.title: Minimum Threshold

steps.description: An email will be sent using this Email template if slots availability goes below the set threshold. Defaults to [Default] Appointment Group Availability.
steps.label: Email Template
steps.title: Email Template

steps.description: Email alerts will be sent to all the mandatory members, plus the email address set in this field.
steps.label: Email Address
steps.title: Email Address

steps.description: You can link this Appointment Group with a doctype from here. Just select the doctype you want to link it to.
steps.label: Link with Doctype
steps.title: Link with Doctype.

steps.description:
[Optional]
Here, you can set a HTTPS URL, or a frappe function path, which should be called after an meeting is scheduled using this appointment group. This allows you to customize the Frappe Appointment to your needs. If the function, or https call throws an error, the event will not be scheduled.
steps.label: Webhook
steps.title: Webhook
